GPUGetPreferredCanvasFormat.summary:
The getPreferredCanvasFormat() method of the
interface returns the optimal canvas texture format for displaying 8-bit depth, standard dynamic range content on the current system.

remarks.para: This is commonly used to provide a call with the optimal format value for the current system. This is recommended â€” if you don't use the preferred format when configuring the canvas context, you may incur additional overhead, such as additional texture copies, depending on the platform.

GPUGetPreferredCanvasFormat.returns: A string indicating a canvas texture format. The value can be rgba8unorm or bgra8unorm.
